title: Roots and Crowns
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Tim Rutili's Chicago collective outdoes itself on this record, which sounds like ancient mountain and Delta traditions synthesized-- scratched up, muddied, and re-imagined for an America more reliant on machines than the grace of God.

title: Mosaic
label: Sounds Familyre
description: Mosaic

title: Awesome Color
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: Ecstatic Peace band's melodic fuzz and throaty howls ape the Stooges and other 1970s hard rock greats.

title: Melody Mountain
label: Rune Grammofon
description: Building on the unusual interpretations it performs live, the Norwegian duo recorded an entire album of covers; unlikely choices including AC/DC's "It's a Long Way to the Top" and Kiss' "Crazy, Crazy Nights" are slowed to a crawl and injected with a sense of bleak foreboding.

title: The Word From Pluto
label: Hello Sir
description: With influences ranging from Les Savy Fav to Devo, this indie rock band makes dance-punk, spazz-rock, rawk-revival, and post-hardcore-- all for at least a minute at a time.

title: PopArt: The Hits
label: Capitol
description: Released three years ago in the UK, this 2xCD best-of-- splitting the synth-pop group's impulses into "Pop" (disco) and "Art" (ballads)-- is finally issued in the U.S.

title: Soft Machine
label: Atlantic
description: Swedish grindcore-cum-stereo selector trio make its North American debut with an eclectic album featuring contributions from Annie, Elephant Man, and Neneh Cherry, among others.

title: In the Maybe World
label: Young God
description: Veteran singer/songwriter continues her push-pull between pretty and unsettling on this, her seventh album.

title: See Mi Yah Remixes
label: Burial
description: Rhythm & Sound makes a welcome return to the dancefloor on a remix album that's both an homage to Basic Channel's dubwise legacy and a repudiation of reflexive brow-furrowing.

title: for hero: for fool
label: Astralwerks
description: Marking both its major-label debut and first album since a van accident that left keyboardist Dax Pierson paralyzed, the idiosyncratic hip-hop collective creates a set that's harder, angrier, and, yes, better than anything it has previously done.

title: ...Until We Felt Red
label: Velour
description: After two albums of ornate fingerpicking and sedate slides, this guitarist and 90s Chicago post-rock aficianado adds breathy vocals to her arsenal.

title: As Tall as Lions
label: EastWest
description: Sophomore release from Long Island rockers is schmaltzy alterna-rock that splits the difference between Jeff Buckley and Coldplay.

title: Noxagt
label: Load
description: Norwegian math-metal outfit replaces Nils Erga's viola with guitar from Anders Hana of Ultralyd, but Noxagt's dark, punishing vision remains intact.

title: The Information
label: Interscope
description: The Information

title: This Cursed House
label: Quite Scientific
description: Based not in the Great White North but Ann Arbor, Mich., this upstart septet proves it has a handle on recent indietastic touchstones Sufjan Stevens and the Arcade Fire.

title: Friendly Fire
label: Capitol
description: John and Yoko's son returns with his first album in eight years, a record steeped in baroque piano-bar melodies, foreboding Jon Brion string arrangements, and a palpable sense of empty-bed despair.

title: The Crane Wife
label: Capitol
description: Colin Meloy's theatrical and hyperliterate band makes an unexpected move to Capitol Records, and delivers a record that matches the ambition of its new imprint.

title: Shine On
label: Elektra
description: NSFW

title: Carnavas
label: Dangerbird
description: Smashing Pumpkins soundalikes from L.A. spin spiderweb-rock and scream a lot.

title: Release Therapy
label: Def Jam
description: Up till now, Ludacris has never truly lived up to his name.  It's finally going "serious" that crossed the line.

title: Boys and Girls in America
label: Vagrant
description: Like an American Jarvis Cocker, Craig Finn narrates tales of kids who dance and drink and screw cuz they've got nothing else to do-- and he does it all with a depth and scope rarely seen in contemporary rock.

title: Heat Chief
label: HOSS
description: Baltimore quartet-- pronounced "Wet Hearts"-- aim for a Boredoms-like transcendence through repetition and incremental adjustments.

title: Today Is Tonight
label: Drama Club
description: Promising Chicago indie band follows its EP with a record that boils down its well-worn influences to a distinctive sound.

title: The Odd Church
label: Hybris
description: Swedish band's third record is frontloaded with hooky songs reminiscent of loudly melodic artists like Pixies and the Ramones.

title: Gang of Losers
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Montreal post-Britpop band follows its well-publicized 2003 album No Cities Left with a record that mixes jangly pop with darker material.

title: There Is a Season
label: Columbia
description: This 4xCD box splits its four discs evenly between the two distinct phases of the band-- the proto-jangle, folk-pop group and the country-rock pioneers-- and includes a bonus DVD of 1960s TV appearances.

title: The Lemonheads
label: Vagrant
description: After years as a sort of high-profile busker, Evan Dando recruits a couple of former Descendents and reimagines the Lemonheads, leaning more toward the group's punk-tinged beginnings than its sunny, major-label pop.

title: If Thine Enemy Hunger
label: Relapse
description: Fuzz-rock group brings 1990s alterna-metal into the 21st century, just like they've been doing for a decade.

title: The Kids at the Club
label: How Does It Feel to Be Loved?
description: Compilation from a label affiliated with London club night How Does It Feel to Be Loved? surveys the current indie pop landscape, including tracks from Voxtrot, I'm From Barcelona, and Amelia Fletcher.

title: Berlin Serengeti
label: Ubiquity
description: Genre-crazed project helmed by Berlin's Niko Schabel is a cinematic tour through rock, soul, bossa nova, dub, trip-hop, Middle Eastern modes, and much more.

title: Dreamt for Light Years in the Belly of a Mountain
label: Astralwerks
description: Five years in the making, Mark Linkous' latest was recorded piecemeal and features contributions from Tom Waits, Danger Mouse, and the Flaming Lips' Steve Drozd.

title: Remixes
label: Domino
description: Remixes

title: El Gran Baile
label: Emperor Norton
description: Uwe Schmidt, also known as Atom Heart, Se\xF1or Coconut, and several dozen other\n\ aliases (he's released more ...

title: Forever Debts
label: Semaphore
description: Second album from the power-pop artist is a shade darker than its predecessor, but with sharply observed lyrics that don't so much tell stories as dig around in the feelings that well up during a story's climax.

title: Slappers
label: !K7
description: Second solo album from Matthew Herbert's frequent chantuese features less of his productions and more song-based structures.

title: Wait EP
label: Good
description: With the release of its third album delayed until 2007, the oversized Texas band offer this iTunes EP, featuring two new songs and covers of Nirvana, the Psychedelic Furs (both produced by Jon Brion), and Spree frontman Tim DeLaughter's former band, Tripping Daisy.

title: Okonokos
label: ATO
description: Recorded at San Francisco's famed Fillmore West, this 2xCD, 21-track live album finds the Kentucky band shedding its regional associations and signature reverb but still reinventing classic rock.

title: Time Without Consequence
label: Zero Summer
description: The Scottish-born, London-raised, and Los Angeles-living Nick Drake soundalike finally issues his long-awaited debut album.

title: Arts & Crafts
label: Memphis Industries
description: Steve Webster moves between the monsters of art school post-punk, kraut rock, and late-1990s slacker electronica on his debut Memphis Industries LP.

title: Dark Light Daybreak
label: Saddle Creek
description: Saddle Creek dream-pop band apes the song construction and messianic guitar rock of U2.

title: Meek Warrior
label: Young God
description: After this year's spectacular split-release with Angels of Light, these Young God artists take a more elemental, toned-down approach. Jazz drummer Hamid Drake guests.

title: Ta-Dah!
label: Polydor
description: The second album from the disco-tinged group is even more streamlined, pop-minded, and high-spirited than its 2004 self-titled debut.

title: Into the Blue Again
label: Sub Pop
description: Composer/multi-instrumentalist James LaValle takes his post-rock band on a tour of the genre's familiar haunts.

title: The Bells of 1 2
label: Grönland
description: The debut album from this classically trained pianist and cellist and Sparklehorse compatriot is intended to be an enormous statement about the nature of humanity and the metaphysics of love.

title: Personality: One Was a Spider, One Was a Bird
label: Astralwerks
description: Eccentric Australian songwriter Luke Steele returns with a record that's essentially 13 remixes of John Lennon's 1974 spaced-odyssey "#9 Dream".

title: And What Have You Done With My Body God?
label: ZTT
description: This 4xCD set celebrates the work of Trevor Horn and Paul Morley's early 1980s collective-- a highly conceptual group that used primitive sampling technology to become pioneers of electro, hip-hop, and Latin freestyle and house.

title: The Man Who Lives for Love
label: Yep Roc
description: Originally issued in Japan in 2001, this collaboration between Jon Spencer and brothers Luther and Cody Dickinson (the North Mississippi All-Stars) is finally released in the U.S., aided by the addition of six bonus tracks.

title: Have You Seen the Other Side of the Sky?
label: Ace Fu
description: Makoto Kawabata and his psych-rock juggernaut reunite with the Melting Paraiso U.F.O. ensemble after a yearlong hiatus.

title: On Cutting Ti-Gers in Half and Understanding Narravation
label: New Granada
description: Idiosyncratic chamber-pop group offers a debut record full of emotionally fraught compositions.

title: Human Animal
label: Sub Pop
description: The Sub Pop noise group returns with another collection of tracks exploring the cycle of tension and release.

title: Food & Liquor
label: Atlantic
description: Debut album from the Chicago MC and Kanye West protégé is proudly out of step with contemporary hip-hop-- despite contributions from his mentor, Jay-Z, and the Neptunes.

title: Takers and Leavers EP
label: Park the Van
description: Philadelphia trad-rock band teases two tracks from its forthcoming LP on yet another gutless paean to classic pop.

title: Appreciation Night
label: Flameshovel
description: Chicago indie rock band builds on the promise of its debut EP with an album full of fuzzy guitars and turn-on-a-dime shifts in rhythm and tone.

title: Blood Mountain
label: Reprise
description: Prog-metal's best band returns with a record that may be even better than its monumental Leviathan LP. Please welcome the new monsters of rock.

title: Son of the Tiger
label: Frenchkiss
description: Brooklyn trio plays noisy, mostly instrumental post-rock that ranges from dark and gloomy to raucous and explosive.

title: Waiting for the Next End of the World
label: Dischord
description: Former Jawbox and Burning Airlines leader J. Robbins returns with his first full-length in five years, this follow-up to his new trio's 2004 EP Waiting for the Next End of the World.

title: Talk to la Bomb
label: Verve Forecast
description: Second album from versatile New York contingent improves on its debut, playing down the call-and-response jams while making more imaginative use of electronics.

title: Knives Don't Have Your Back
label: Last Gang
description: Metric leader and Broken Social Scene member offers frank takes on misery, simple piano figures, and subtle adornments on her first proper solo release.

title: The Outsider
label: Interscope
description: Josh Davis' third album is an odd mélange of exotica, hyphy, and alt-rock, featuring guest spots by both David Banner and Christina Carter. No, really.

title: Violence Is Golden
label: Dim Mak
description: Dim Mak band's debut is in places reminiscent of a mid-1990s synth-grunge crossover, PJ Harvey-like goth-pop, or nu-blues rock such as the Kills.

title: AWOO
label: Rough Trade
description: The Canadian indie pop collective's latest album drops much of the potty-minded content and harps'n'horns extravagance of its predecessors.

title: The Letting Go
label: Palace
description: On his latest record, Will Oldham enlists the help of Faun Fables vocalist Dawn McCarthy to create a record that presents the humor, dread, and resignation that inform his best music in blissfully unfiltered form.

label: Atlantic
description: Film actress and daughter of Serge Gainsbourg and Jane Birkin gets help from Jarvis Cocker, Air, Neil Hannon, and Nigel Godrich on her second album.

title: Tell Me
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Full-length debut by Chicago roots-rockers veers from swampy gospel to taut funk, adding instrumentation to flesh out the sound of their EP Please Come Back.

title: Dreams
label: Bubbles
description: Kings of Convenience leader and self-proclaimed "singing DJ" Erlend Øye returns with his most "rock" effort to date.

title: Total 7
label: Kompakt
description: The latest compilation from Komapkt's venerable Total series collects vinyl releases and exclusive tracks and finds the label again entrenched at the center of frantic back-and-forth movements within German dance music circles.

title: And I Feel Fine
label: Capitol
description: Subtitled The Best of the I.R.S. Years 1982-1987, this 2xCD set collects the best of the landmark band's pre-major label output, reminding us that a lifetime ago the group enjoyed a period of sustained and boundless creativity and helped to define and codify indie rock.

title: Hell Songs
label: Hydra Head
description: Providence's resident shock artists return with more techy grindcore, now mixed with elements of Nation of Ulysses and the Make Up.

title: Stella
label: Touch and Go
description: Dovetailing nicely with the recent Touch & Go anniversary shows, this Sicilian band makes a welcome comeback, offering its first new album in eight years.

title: Meadow
label: Merge
description: Former folkie picks up where his 2004 Merge bow Dents and Shells left off-- creating melodically portentous tracks topped with his gruff yet honeyed voice.

title: The Air Force
label: 5RC
description: Jamie Stewart's engaging, unflinching band unleashes its most understated and relatively sweetest album to date.

title: Transparent Things
label: Tirk
description: Fujiya & Miyagi aren't Japanese; they just want to be. But while Nippon culture may be this Brighton, England trio's first love, musically they're doing for 70s krautrock and motorik what the DFA did for early 80s electro.

title: Peeping Tom
label: Ipecac
description: Six years in the making, this Mike Patton-led project features contributions from Massive Attack, Norah Jones, Kool Keith, Bebel Gilberto, and members of the Ninja Tune and Anticon rosters.

title: Acoustics
label: 5RC
description: Zach Hill and Spencer Seim offer precise acoustic versions of tracks from their recent albums Hold Your Horse Is and The Devil Isn't Red.

title: Fading Trails
label: Secretly Canadian
description: The prolific Jason Molina returns with an album that synthesizes his old, solo Songs:Ohia work with the full-band, blues-influenced rock he's been crafting for the past few years.

title: FutureSex / LoveSounds
label: Jive
description: The pop star offers his ambitious, grandiose sophomore album: Almost entirely produced by Timbaland-- and with a more pronounced hip-hop edge than its predecessor-- the album abandons the feelgood sheen which the Neptunes peddled so adroitly on his debut, Justified, but makes up for it with the largesse of its sonic embrace.

title: Love & Other Planets
label: Domino
description: Fridge bassist's second solo album of soft folk-pop is a gentler affair than its predecessor.

title: Lanzafame
label: Catbird
description: Released by a blogger's label, this debut perhaps unsurprisingly sounds a lot like the Arcade Fire and other contemporary indie bands; that's not necessarily a bad thing.

title: Amputechture
label: Interscope
description: The Mars Volta's new album is partially a Lynchian pro-immigration statement that, we assume, will thrill lovers of musical onanism.

title: Pieces of the People We Love
label: Interscope
description: Three years after the still-wonderful Echoes, the former DFA band team with Paul Epworth, Ewan Pearson, and Danger Mouse to helm a more meticulous, cleaner version of their once-gritty indie-dance sound.

title: Magic Potion
label: Nonesuch
description: Classic rock-loving blues-rock duo follow the warm Rubber Factory-- and make its Nonesuch bow-- with this more austere collection.

title: I Am Not Afraid of You and I Will Beat Your Ass
label: Matador
description: Indie rock vets follow the disappointing Summer Sun with an expansive, ambitious record exploring every style in their repertoire, and a few new ones, too.

title: Sing Song EP
label: Astralwerks
description: Joyful indie pop makers from Los Angeles push the limits of cheery, and sort of succeed.

title: Post Cro-Magnon Drift
label: Yellow Ball
description: Mark Lesseraux's free-associative lyrics and powerful delivery head an indie band now exerting more control over its sound, locating a balance between grit and sophistication.

title: Nautical Antiques
label: Ace Fu
description: Subtitled A Selection of Rarities From 1998-2001, this collection of leftovers is characterized by the band's anemic grooves and clockwork beauty.

title: Pet Sounds: 40th Anniversary
label: Capitol
description: Pet Sounds: 40th Anniversary

title: K1
label: Arena Rock
description: Debut album from this Oregon band is catchy, but conceptually clunky.

title: Living Room
label: Plug Research
description: Latest project from Ammoncontact's Carlos Niño mixes *TNT­-*style post-rock, neo-shoegaze indie pop, and lyrical after-the-rain jazz fusion.

title: Varcharz
label: Ipecac
description: Appropriately, the German electronic group's first album on Mike Patton's Ipecac label is its heaviest to date, running bouncy instrumentals through a filter that renders the music colder, blockier, louder, and flatter.

title: Gravity Won't Get You High
label: Interscope
description: Brisbane band tries to capture its manic live energy on record, with help from famed producer Brian Deck.

title: Live in: Nerd Rage!
label: Relapse
description: "Mr. Show" vet covers everything from porn to Star Wars to post-war Iraq on this Relapse-released comedy album.

title: Zeno Beach
label: Yep Roc
description: Australian proto-punks break a quarter-century of silence on record with forceful new material that matches and even surpasses the work that made them legends.

title: Serene Velocity: A Stereolab Anthology
label: Rhino
description: Yes, another Stereolab compilation; this one focuses on the band's 11 years on Elektra Records.

title: Yellow House
label: Warp
description: Edward Droste follows his group's lo-fi debut Horn of Plenty by employing a fulltime band, moving to Warp, and expanding his ambition and sound. The result is a major step forward for the group, as well as one of the year's best records.

title: To the Races
label: Saddle Creek
description: First proper solo release from Crooked Fingers mastermind is full of spare and intimate folk songs.

title: Ultimate Prince
label: Rhino
description: This Prince best of covers the Warner Brothers years-- 1979-92-- and features one disc of album versions and one of 12" mixes.

title: Crazy Itch Radio
label: XL
description: After three records of musical maximalism, Simon Radcliffe and Felix Buxton unveil a new kind of Basement Jaxx album: A grower, one that doesn't exhaust you the first time around the track but one that accrues meaning and gets more enjoyable with each new spin.

title: Good God! A Gospel Funk Hymnal
label: Numero Group
description: Numero Group examines the intersect between gospel and funk on the label's latest well-crafted compilation.

label: Drag City
description: Latest record from the former Slint and Tortoise player finds him emphasizing traditional craft and instrumentation instead of brooding experimentation.

title: Paris 1919
label: Reprise
description: Rhino reissues this stately, haunting masterpiece, adding 11 previously unreleased tracks-- nearly tripling the running length of the original album.

title: One Day It Will Please Us to Remember Even This
label: Roadrunner
description: Glam-punk pioneers stage an unlikely and possibly unwelcome comeback.

title: All This Time
label: Fat Possum
description: Unpretentious Midwestern blues-rock duo delivers its sophomore Fat Possum release.

title: Oxytocin
label: Makeshift Music
description: The band's third album finds them thinking big, as they pile on instruments and layer harmonies into massive choirs.

title: Game Theory
label: Def Jam
description: On its Def Jam debut, the veteran hip-hop band avoids wilds tangents and trims some of its freewheeling ways; the resulting record is svelte, smart, lively, and one of the year's most pleasant surprises.

title: A Million Microphones
label: Touch and Go
description: This Washington D.C. dance-punk band, made of former members of El Guapo, show promise on its second Touch & Go release.

title: The Sad Part
label: Black Freighter
description: Led by Pitchfork contributor Michael Idov, this band's wit, tact, and striking language serves specificity and beauty, not Decemberists-style ostentation.

title: Ashes Against the Grain
label: The End
description: Oregon metal band's latest record is their hugest, most artful collection to date.

title: Kelis Was Here
label: Jive
description: The r&b singer returns with her fourth album and first without regular collaborators the Neptunes, teaming instead with a revolving cast that includes Scott Storch, Will.I.Am, Shondrae, and Raphael Saadiq.

title: Post-War
label: Merge
description: Consistently rewarding Merge singer-songwriter gets help from Neko Case and My Morning Jacket's Jim James on his latest album.

title: Sorry About the Flowers
label: One Percent Press
description: Athens band's debut is full of doleful, nostalgic pop, with strings, keys, and bells augmenting the traditional guitar-led lineup.

title: Garden Cities of To-morrow
label: Boompa
description: Sophomore record by Canadian chanteuse finds her working with production team Hercules, who back her whimsical songs with lavish arrangements.

title: Thunder Down Under
label: Swami
description: Culled from in-studio performances recorded in an Australia radio station, this posthumous live album fails to capture the group's in-person prowess.

title: Modern Times
label: Columbia
description: The music legend returns with a companion piece to 2001's Love and Theft, offering new tracks of jazz-inspired, rockabilly-scamming, ragtime-aping rock'n'roll, more heavily indebted to blues and honky-tonk than Woody Guthrie and Folkways.

title: Over the Mountain, Across the Valley, and Back to the Stars
label: Matador
description: Indie folk singer's third album-- and first for Matador-- includes forthright lyrics and vocal performances and songs inspired by the deaths of her two sisters.

title: Damaged
label: Merge
description: Kurt Wagner's shapeshifting group offers its 10th album, this one featuring the contributions and influence of Nashville-based laptop group Hands Off Cuba.

title: The Future Crayon
label: Unknown
description: Endlessly rewarding English avant-pop band gathers its post-Work and Non-Work B-sides, EP tracks, and compilation rarities.

title: Bring That Beat Back
label: Koch
description: The once-visionary hip-hop outfit offers up its later work, along with first single "Public Enemy No. 1", to remixers like Rae & Christian and Johnny Juice.

title: No Midnight
label: spinART
description: Indie rock band trades in agreeable-emo vocals and earnest careerism. Yes, another one.

title: Exoteric
label: Load
description: Vocal-shredding Chicago duo Metalux collaborates with ever-prolific noise maven for a record of pounding rhythms and sporadic beauty.

title: Let Me Go Let Me Go Let Me Go
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Magnolia Electric Co. and Songs:Ohia singer-songwriter takes a few steps away from his recent full, collaborative sound.

title: Songs From the Coal Mine Canary
label: Durtro
description: Genre-bouncing New York songstress gets by with a little help from Antony.

title: Born and Raised in Compton: The Greatest Hits
label: Arista
description: This best-of focuses on the oft-unheralded Compton producer and MC's solo work, which served as a more danceable foil to his hometown's nihilistic hedonism.

title: Skelliconnection
label: Sub Pop
description: Sub Pop performer issues his second album, another impressive document of his intuitive and inventive songwriting.

title: Get Lonely
label: 4AD
description: John Darnielle's latest is a meditation on loss, inspired by the dissolution of a romantic relationship, and in its own way is as dark and brutal as his gut-wrenching 2005 album/memoir The Sunset Tree.

title: Young Mountain
label: Magic Bullet
description: Texas band creates brooding instrumental music that's heavy on atmosphere despite the relative brevity of the disc.

title: The Shining
label: BBE
description: This posthumous release from the much-missed Detroit producer and MC was completed by Karriem Riggins and features guest spots from Common, D'Angelo, and Black Thought.

title: Happy Hollow
label: Saddle Creek
description: Tim Kasher's post-emo band tackles topics both deep and mundane on its latest Saddle Creek release.

title: Schmotime
label: Memphis Industries
description: Debut full-length from London quintet finds the gruff-voiced Dan Michaelson exploring sexual politics from every angle.

title: Anti-Anti
label: Jade Tree
description: Debut from brooding Atlanta four-piece is filled with crisp and efficient songs that mix the personal and political.

title: Bring Me the Workhorse
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: On My Brightest Diamond's debut, Sufjan Stevens-collaborator Shara Worden blends the artsy end of indie rock with classical touches to sometimes stunning effect.

title: The Body, The Blood, The Machine
label: Sub Pop
description: This Oregon-based, politically informed punk band return with their grandest, loudest, and most electrifying record to date.

title: In Concert Volume One
label: Yep Roc
description: Powerful live album argues convincingly that the stage is where the versatile Sadies are most at home. Guests include Neko Case, Kelly Hogan, and Jon Langford, among others.

title: Classics
label: XL
description: Expert programmers Evan Mast and Mike Stroud follow their self-titled debut with a more refined collection of indie electronica.

title: Idlewild
label: Arista
description: Big Boi and Dre follow their highly acclaimed 2003 release Speakerboxxx/The Love Below with a soundtrack to a film in which they co-star.

title: Kill Them With Kindness
label: Polyvinyl
description: Kill Them With Kindness

title: Port of Miami
label: Def Jam
description: Rising Def Jam star follows his huge "Hustlin'" single with a debut album that leaves us no closer to learning anything about the MC.

title: Bande a Part
label: Luaka Bop
description: The French producers' second album of 80s covers in a bossa nova style tackles Billy Idol's "Dancing With Myself" and Bauhaus' "Bella Lugosi's Dead", among other new wave and post-punk classics.

title: A Lesson in Crime EP
label: Paper Bag
description: Much-ballyhooed indie upstarts offer twitchy micro-Strokes riffs  and hyper post-punk on this economical, promising EP.

title: The Complete BBC Peel Sessions
label: Chemikal Underground
description: Oft-overlooked Scottish indie band traces its five-album evolution from typical Sonic Youth/Pavement-worshipping fuzz junkies to soft-rock sophisticates on this collection of BBC sessions.

title: A Lazarus Taxon
label: Thrill Jockey
description: This 3xCD/DVD package collects singles, B-sides, and remixes released between 1995 and 2001-- including the whole of the band's long out-of-print remix EP Rhythms, Resolutions, and Clusters.

title: Impeccable Blahs
label: Euphobia
description: Eric Elbogen warbles about vampires atop a perch of sturdy if unremarkable indie rock. Again.

title: Solo Guitar
label: Silber
description: This, um, solo guitar record finds the Low frontman exploring the physical.

title: Made In Brooklyn
label: Nature Sounds
description: Underrated, late-coming Wu member's latest features contributions from many of his Clan mates, as well as MF Doom.

title: So This Is Goodbye
label: Domino
description: The second album by this Canadian electronic indie pop band finds vocalist Jeremy Greenspan without the aid of founding member and presumed rhythmic engine Johnny Dark but in greater command of his elegant melodies, exquisite pacing, and marvellously tensile voice.

title: When I Live by the Garden and the Sea EP
label: Temporary Residence
description: Matthew Cooper presents this four-track EP, an addendum to his gorgeous 2005 album Talk Amongst the Trees.

title: Flashlights
label: self-released
description: St. Louis' band's sophomore release recalls Les Savy Fav and Dismemberment Plan, but expands the band's sound with horns, keys, and a 30 piece choir.

title: Avatar
label: Sub Pop
description: Ethan Miller and co. (which now includes Ben Chasny) follow the full-bore rock of Blue Cathedral with this more wistful, relatively calm release.

title: Alter
label: Hydra Head
description: Alter

title: Kalas
label: Tee Pee
description: Ex-Sleep guitarist and current High on Fire vocalist/guitarist Matt Pike fronts these Bay Area doom rockers.

title: Dial 0
label: Soma
description: NYC electroclash artist drafts in the help of Antony, Autojulie 3000, and Jay Kauffman on his second album.

title: A Love Moderne
label: Force Tracks
description: Second album from the Swedish house producer who mixed the Digital Disco 3 compilation for the reinvigorated Force Tracks.

title: And the Glass-Handed Kites
label: Sony
description: Danish band takes fairly normal indie reference points-- Radiohead, My Bloody Valentine-- and turns them into lavish, stratospheric, fairy-tale prog.

title: Tam
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: Montreal music fixture has the tracks on her Ecstatic Peace release handpicked by Thurston Moore himself.

title: Have It All
label: Chicks on Speed
description: Part travelogue, part self-help manual, this English ex-pat-- who counts Peaches, Kevin Blechdom, Jamie Lidell, and Chicks On Speed among her friends-- uses her self-imposed alienation to examine personal truths.

title: Alternation
label: 5RC
description: Having put their own spin on ramshackle krautrock and busted house, the unremittingly experimental Excepter move toward a more organized sound and flirt with bona fide songs.

title: Sæglópur EP
label: The Worker's Institute

title: Wolves in Wolves' Clothing
label: Fat Wreck Chords
description: Pop-punk veterans still know their way around a hook and are still offering anti-Bush polemics.

title: To Find Me Gone
label: Dicristina
description: The second album from Andy Cabic and co. finds them nudging toward the lost canyons of airy West Coast soft-rock and laid-back, country-tinged introspection.

title: Personal File
label: Columbia
description: This 2xCD set of unreleased tracks, mostly acoustic, date as far back as the early 1970s and were recorded ostensibly for private listening, not necessarily for public consumption.

title: Trans Canada Highway EP
label: Warp
description: This six-track EP features four new BoC productions, an Odd Nosdam remix, and the Scottish duo's first music video.

title: Look at Who You're Talking To
label: Gigantic
description: Plainly derivative, this shoegaze-twee band comes off as weirdly refreshing all the same.

title: A Temporary Dive
label: V2
description: Like fellow Scandinavian José González, this Norway-born, Sweden-based singer offers sparse, English-language songs fluent in the well-established idioms of North American and British folk.

title: The Warning
label: Astralwerks
description: Electro-soul band's second album abandons the graceful, delicate melodies of its debut for songs with more wallop.

title: Lightning Ghost
label: Kranky
description: Latest album from Town & Country co-conspirator Ben Vida's one-man army of lo-fi buzz-and-drone experiments.

title: Passover
label: Light in the Attic
description: Texas-based psych-rockers follow fellow drone lovers the Velvet Underground and Spacemen 3 on this Light in the Attic release.

title: Sexteen
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Veteran indie band's 16th effort is a "concept album about fucking."

title: The Dividing Island
label: Kemado
description: The art collective's new LP recalls sumptuously produced electro-orchestral New Pop and has the air of a carefully constructed artifact hermetically sealed under glass.

title: The Obliterati
label: Matador
description: Second comeback album from the Boston post-punk band is the work of a group that's totally comfortable, and confident, within its own skin.

title: Simpatico
label: Sanctuary
description: If 1999's Us and Us Only was the UK vets' "Dylan album" and 2001's Wonderland their "Studio 54-era Stones album," this record could be called the band's "Jamaican album."

title: Wow Twist
label: Chicks on Speed
description: On its fourth full-length, this French laptop gang delightfully draw out the pop elements in its 8-bit electro sound.

title: Eyes Open
label: Interscope
description: Another competent effort from the former twee band, now practitioners of Coldplay-like dramatic ballads.

title: A Hundred Miles Off
label: Recordcollection
description: After two records packed with the kind of unrelenting, energetic furor that rock music built its rep on, Hamilton Leithauser and co. embrace blurred sonics and a Dylanesque squeal on their latest album.

title: A Life Without Fear
label: Staubgold
description: German producer and theoretician delivers a fractured but surprisingly thorough look at the blues-- what it means, where it has come from, and how it left its fingerprints.

title: Tasankokaiku
label: Fonal
description: Finnish electro-instrumentalist quartet breezily mix the minimalist repetitions of Terry Riley with the analog shimmer of Broadcast.

title: Music to Fall Asleep
label: Kompakt
description: Latest processed guitar-filled record from Kompakt Pop Ambient fixture Sebastian Meissner.

title: Beneath Waves
label: K
description: K Records artist impressively navigates folk, dub, grunge-like rock, and more.

title: The Invisible Deck
label: Too Pure
description: This lively, politically charged record recalls X's boisterous male/female mantras and Sonic Youth's frosty downtown cool.

title: Monster of the Absolute
label: Strange Attractors Audio House
description: When compared to its predecessor, 2004's Satin Black, the latest from these Detroit space-rock vets is a model of precision that, at times, dovetails nicely with some of the more shoegazerly moments of Boris or Jesu.

title: The Spell
label: Touch and Go
description: The first BHP record made by a fully integrated band is also the group's best, fleshing out its already arresting sound.

title: Killa Season
label: Warner Bros.
description: Harlem Dipset magnate follows a string of relentless mixtapes and the soul-infused 2004 masterpiece Purple Haze with the soundtrack to a film about a hardscrabble hustler.

title: Do the Musiking
label: Pickled Egg
description: Avant/classical/folk duo Big Eyes add Rachel Grimes (Rachel's), Jeremy Barnes (Neutral Milk Hotel, A Hawk and a Hacksaw), and Scottish folkie James Yorkston to its family for a 29-track record that was three years in the making.

title: Pick a Bigger Weapon
label: Epitaph
description: Another strong effort from the Bay Area hip-hop group-- smart, politically aware lyrics couched in full-figured, Parliament/Prince digi-funk.

title: Powder Burns
label: One Little Indian
description: Greg Dulli resurrects the guitar drama of 2003's Blackberry Belle and continues to draw on specific 1990s alt-rock elements-- an extreme dynamic between verse and chorus and the belief that a soaring chorus is half the message.

title: II
label: Drag City
description: Now a sextet, this Philadelphia band's latest is far darker, deeper, and more ominous than its predecessors.

title: News & Tributes
label: Vagrant
description: Sunderland band's sophomore album-- released in the UK this month and the U.S. in June-- jettisons its predecessor's blood-pumping compactness in favor of a less focused sound stretched out across a larger sonic space.

title: The Mezzanine
label: Warm
description: These Brooklynites-- owners of the Apestaartje imprint-- assemble eight discrete tracks that function as immersive atmospheres in miniature.

title: Yes! Tinnitus!
label: Too Pure
description: This eclectic, bombastic record-- originally released in 2004-- finally makes its way to U.S. shores.

label: Drag City
description: This is the debut album by a new project led by Carl Barât, the less tabloid-ready ex-Libertine.

title: The Sound the Hare Heard
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Eight-song, 35-minute record collects some of the band's Witching Hour-era odds and sods.

title: Seclusion
label: Undergroove
description: This eclectic, bombastic record-- originally released in 2004-- finally makes its way to U.S. shores.

title: Waterloo to Anywhere
label: Interscope
description: This is the debut album by a new project led by Carl Barât, the less tabloid-ready ex-Libertine.

title: Broken Boy Soldiers
label: V2
description: The White Stripes' Jack White heads this Midwest supergroup, which also includes fellow Michigander Brendan Benson and the rhythm section from I-75 commuters the Greenhornes.

title: Remember That I Love You
label: K
description: Warm, twee folk-pop singer and former Moldy Peach houses her sprawling, humorous stories in beds of minimal, home-tracked instrumentation.

title: Keep Breathing
label: Artful
description: A return to form for Vini Reilly following the gorgeously sad Someone Else's Party (2003) and the tepid Tempus Fugit (2004).

title: Gulag Orkestar
label: Ba Da Bing!
description: Impressive, precocious debut from this Brookyln-based teenager pairs his acrobatic, emotionally nuanced voice with Eastern European and NMH-like accoutrements.

title: Miastenia
label: Load
description: First official U.S. release from this Italian duo will likely be the most romantic metal album this year.

title: The Million Colour Revolution
label: Nacional
description: Nacional release harks back to the days of indie pop as a time-traveling, transcontinental hodgepodge-- think Stereo Total, Pizzicato Five, Cibo Matto, Sukia, and Arling & Cameron.

title: Fort Recovery
label: Misra
description: Ten years strong, this Misra band offers an album of perfectly performed sincere-dudes-with-guitars rock.

title: Surprise
label: Warner Bros.
description: Famed singer-songwriter enlists Brian Eno to create the sort of newfangled electronica-meets-classic-rock album that Paul McCartney, Mick Jagger, and Eric Clapton attempted last decade.

title: A Gilded Age EP
label: Hush
description: Portland-based singer/songwriter Adam Selzer and his formerly hushed folk collective incorporate a large assortment of instruments and full-band arrangements on their new EP.

title: Long Dry Cold
label: Neglektra
description: Veteran journeymen indie band contemplates a name change before releasing its latest record.

title: Palo Santo
label: Misra
description: Okkervil River keyboardist Jonathan Meiburg takes the reins on the latest record from this side project, resulting in the group's best effort to date.

title: Stadium Arcadium
label: Warner Bros.
description: 2xCD set of arena-friendly songs about California, sex, and having sex in California is split between slightly askew mid-tempo pop and regrettable relapses into funk and muso noodling.

title: Just Like the Fambly Cat
label: V2
description: After roughly a decade of slowly built, home-studio sonics, this well-liked band rides off into the Modesto sunset with the release of this album.

title: Cities
label: Yep Roc
description: Yep Rock band's debut LP is reminiscent of oft-cited college-rock milestones of the 1980s such as Joy Division, Echo & the Bunnymen, and R.E.M.

title: Soft Money
label: Anticon
description: After years of work with Themselves, Subtle, and 13 & God, the Anticon artist issues his debut LP.

title: Sur La Mer Samp-Le-Mer
label: 5RC
description: 5RC label comp features previously unreleased material from Deerhoof, Hella, Xiu Xiu, and the Mae Shi.

title: The Rose Has Teeth in the Mouth of a Beast
label: Matador
description: On its fifth, most-engaging album, the duo create biographical "sound portraits" of historically and culturally important gay figures, which incorporate details relevant to a particular person's life or practice.

title: The Drift
label: 4AD
description: The cult artist's first new studio record since 1995's devastating Tilt was written and produced over a seven-year period, and, like its predecessor, its stories are taken from a varied, almost overstuffed horizon of literature, news stories, Walker's half-forgotten dreams, and otherwise poetic neuroses.

title: Only
label: Thirsty Ear
description: Thirsty Ear's Blue Series-- which forcibly boggles the vocabularies of modern jazz, electronics, and hip-hop-- offers a cross-textual platform for the former Antipop Consortium iconoclast.

title: Shred Earthship
label: 5RC
description: Debut album from drummer Zack Hill (Hella, Team Sleep, the Ladies) and guitarist Mick Barr (Orthrelm, Octis, Quixotic).

title: DJ-Kicks: The Exclusives
label: !K7
description: The venerable !K7 series collects some of the best previously unreleased tracks from its mixes, including efforts by Carl Craig, Annie, Erlend Øye, and Kruder & Dorfmeister.

title: Without Feathers
label: Vice
description: The second LP from this Vice band is much looser and sparser than its predecessor, downplaying the band's sense of aching drama in favor of a peppy enthusiasm.

title: St. Elsewhere
label: Downtown
description: Cee-Lo and Danger Mouse team for a loose, off-the-cuff record about madness, depression, monsters, visionaries, and being yourself.

title: Meds
label: Astralwerks
description: Latest record from the oddly successful glam- and grunge-influenced rock band.

title: Ideal Lives
label: Frenchkiss
description: Frenchkiss group takes great strides between its 2005 EP and this, its debut album, which sounds like a much older band's record played with a younger band's chutzpah.

title: Silver EP
label: Hydra Head
description: Justin Broadrick again shows the world's neo-shoegazers how it should be done.

title: In Praise of Shadows
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Rob Mazurek and Chad Taylor create a seven-song suite using a consistent pulse as a base from which to explore ideas and textures.

title: Breaking Kayfabe
label: Upper Class
description: Rising Canadian hip-hop artist offers underground-leaning lyrics over gargantuan synth riffs and decidedly non-boom bappy beats.

title: Shut Up I Am Dreaming
label: Absolutely Kosher
description: Wolf Parade co-vocalist and keyboardist Spencer Krug's side project completes the progression from rickety, insular lo-fi to well-dressed, multi-hued glam pop.

title: Orchestra of Bubbles
label: Bpitch Control
description: This immersive record combines Allien's melodic, electro-infused techno and Apparat's often melancholic, detail-packed, granular bit-crunchings.

title: Yoyoyoyoyo
label: Big Dada
description: One-time DFA disciple Armani XXXChange, working from a homemade studio in an apartment in Brooklyn, displays a keen ear for smart ways to mash regional and time-lost delicacies.

title: Greatest Hits 1970-1978
label: Rhino
description: Unlike the previous Rhino-released Sabbath collection, this record suffers from some questionable decisions by its compilers.

title: The Secret Miracle Fountain
label: Locust
description: Recorded over the course of several years in 10 countries with contributions from more than 30 people, the third album from this Australian act is a pleasant mess.

title: Pearl Jam
label: J
description: Seattle veterans make their J Records debut with this eponymous, monolithic return to straightforward rock.

title: Kick
label: Independiente
description: Disappointing album fails to offer much beyond the "Love Is a Number" single.

title: Dear John
label: Absolutely Kosher
description: Debut album of lovelorn power-pop from this Absolutely Kosher band.

title: 10,000 Days
label: Volcano
description: Rather than delving further into experimentation or exploring their strengths, the world's most well-loved prog-metal band has made an...A Perfect Circle record.

title: There Is a Difference
label: Swami
description: Detroit rock band tells a bedtime story, the only one: Getting laid, over and over again.

title: Meme
label: Plug Research
description: On his second full-length, this Canadian artist occupies a space between bedroom singer-songwriter and lounge producer.

title: Rio Grande Blood
label: Megaforce
description: Al Jourgensen's 10th proper Ministry LP and second focusing on the current Bush administration features contributions from former members of Killing Joke, Prong, and Danzig.

title: Living With War
label: Reprise
description: Like Bruce Springsteen's We Shall Overcome: The Seeger Sessions, this album features an elder rock statesman making an effective protest record thanks to a raucously communal approach.

title: Somewhere in the Swamps of Jersey
label: Jade Tree
description: Compilation makes the pop-hardcore band's pre-Jade Tree work available en masse.

title: Psychic Secession
label: Load
description: Load band is less crowd-oriented but more catchy than its noise brethren (Forcefield, Mindflayer, Wolf Eyes).

title: Monsieur Gainsbourg Revisited
label: Barclay
description: Serge Gainsbourg tribute album translates song lyrics into English and features contributions from Cat Power, Jarvis Cocker, Portishead, and Tricky, among others.

title: All the Young Dudes / Mott
label: Columbia
description: Columbia/Legacy presents expanded reissues of the glam-boogie band's two best albums.

title: Hind Hind Legs
label: Equator
description: Montreal band are labelmates with Islands on the newly formed Equator Records and are reminiscent of the Unicorns.

title: Idol Tryouts Two: Ghostly International Vol. Two
label: Ghostly
description: This 2xCD compilation-- which features contributions from Matthew Dear, Tim Hecker, and Dabrye, among others-- is split into one disc called "Avant-Pop" and another, more experimental platter titled "SMM".

title: Catastrophe Keeps Us Together
label: Grunion
description: Former emo stars ditch much of their raw, co-ed harmonies and refocus their vocal spotlight to train solely on Caithlin De Marrais.

title: Yo La Tengo Is Murdering the Classics
label: Egon
description: Charity album collects the Jersey band's spontaneous, by-request WFMU benefit covers performances, including takes on tracks from the Beach Boys, Sonic Youth, and Bachman-Turner Overdrive.

title: My Ghetto Report Card
label: Warner Bros.
description: Hyphy veteran works with fellow Bay Area scene-general Rick Rock and crunk's mainstream conduit, Lil Jon, to try to cross his sound over to a national audience.

title: Zeroes and Ones
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Indie veteran's fourth release for Thrill Jockey, and first since 2000's Stalled Parade, finds them working within a broader sonic spectrum than on previous efforts.

title: Back to the Web
label: Ryko
description: E6 holdovers manage to integrate their 1960s folk fetish with their 70s rock jones on this Rykodisc release.

title: Gold Brick
label: ROIR
description: Former Mekons leader and head Waco Brother balances his love of traditional American music and his disgust with American capitalism and consumerism.

title: Sound on Sound
label: Redder
description: Fred Thomas and co. collect numerous seven-inches and tour EPs, and the result is more of a highlight reel than a barrel-scrape.

title: Wolfmother
label: Interscope
description: Debut LP from the hyped Australian band, one of a handful of artists hell-bent on making heavy rock a sizable force in the 2006 musical landscape.

title: Open Season
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Open Season

title: Tum
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Originally issued in a limited run prior to the 2005 album Horus, this subtle psych-folk LP is given a wider release by Secretly Canadian.

title: Expressions (2012 A.U.)
label: Stones Throw
description: Stones Throw's resident bleary-eyed soulman takes welcome strides on this Madlib-produced LP.

title: Second Guessing
label: Amish
description: On its second album of country-fried rock, the once more detail-oriented indie band distills its sound to its most engaging elements.

title: Drowaton
label: Barsuk
description: Barsuk issues the third album from Oklahoma's other orchestral psych-pop band.

title: We Shall Overcome: The Seeger Sessions
label: Sony
description: A boisterous, spirit-raising throwdown on which the Boss tackles the tangle of war, strife, poverty, and unrest without sacrificing joy or release.

title: Pregnant Babies Pregnant With Pregnant Babies
label: Load
description: This scattershot post-Magik Markers band features a couple of former members of Deerhoof.

title: Beautiful Losers: Singles and Compilation Tracks 1994-1999
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Subtitled Singles and Compilation Tracks 1994-1999, this Jagjaguwar collection features hyperactive fingerpicking, melodic dirges, hard-strummed laments, and even a few passing stabs at rock.

title: Beat Konducta Vol. 1-2: Movie Scenes
label: Stones Throw
description: The eccentric producer's welcome glut of releases continues with this 35-track, hour-long instrumentals album.

title: Movements
label: Get Physical
description: The flagship act on Berlin-based Get Physical-- which increasingly resembles early Warp in its elevation of club dynamics to a steely artform-- offers an epochal survey of the varied delights of German house and techno.

title: Body Stories
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: KRS band are a part of Seattle's re-energized political and radical DIY cultural scene.

title: Home to Oblivion: An Elliott Smith Tribute
label: World Village
description: After two albums of Radiohead arrangements for solo piano, this classically trained musician gives the same treatment to the work of the late Elliott Smith.

title: Yes, Virginia
label: Roadrunner
description: On its second LP, this theatrical two-piece smoothes out some of the rougher edges of its debut but still transforms misery into pleasurable artifice-- making music that's at once accessible and profoundly unsettling.

title: Estudando o Pagode: Na Opereta Segregamulher e Amor
label: Luaka Bop
description: Ant\xF4nio Jos\xE9 Santana Martins was born in Brazil's Bahia region in 1936. We know him as Tom ...

title: Nothing Positive Only Negative
label: Relapse
description: North Carolina basement band makes its way to Relapse but aren't quite as misanthropic as its album title would lead you to believe.

title: First Thought, Best Thought
label: Audika
description: The first example of the late musician's instrumental work to be unearthed on Audika features some of the most gorgeous, populist sounds from New York's late-70s avant-garde.

title: Socialize
label: Suicide Squeeze
description: Depressive, monolithic indie rock from this Suicide Squeeze band.

title: SeieS
label: Important
description: Italian post-rock band is like a cross between Godspeed's elliptical storytelling and Swans' doomy elegance.

title: A Blessing and a Curse
label: New West
description: Southern rock band offers its first album that doesn't present a larger picture of the region, here straying from the intense sense of place or perspective that distinguishes its previous efforts.

title: Exit Music: Songs With Radio Heads
label: Rapster
description: Hip-hop and jazz-tinged electronic artists pay tribute to Radiohead on an album that features contributions from Matthew Herbert, Rjd2, Mark Ronson, and the Cinematic Orchestra, among others.

title: Bitter Tea
label: Fat Possum
description: Recorded at roughly the same time as last year's Rehearsing My Choir, the latest from the Freidberger siblings is free of conceptual trappings, and is another carefully considered, sonically rich release.

title: Curses
label: Gern Blandsten
description: Produced by Dave Grohl, this is the third release from a band that's made its name by cannibalizing classic rock and twisting it with a post-hardcore sensibility.

title: Subtítulo
label: Nettwerk
description: First album since switching labels and moving to Spain finds the singer/songwriter continuing to wallow in MOR dreck.

title: We, the Vehicles
label: Flameshovel
description: Second album from this Flameshovel band-- which features two ex-Promise Ringers and the former Dismemberment Plan bassist-- is a dramatic improvement on its predecessor.

title: Kratitude
label: 5RC
description: KRS release from Yeah Yeah Yeahs drummer Brain Chase and guitarist Zachary Lehrhoff of noise duo Ex-Models.

title: Some Echoes
label: Polyvinyl
description: With stripped-down arrangements and a vaguely psychedelic tint, this is the most confident album to date from the Polyvinyl band.

title: Vessel States
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Jagjaguwar issues the second album of spindly guitar work and world-weary dread from the Baltimore-based PiL soundalikes.

title: Skeleton
label: Control Group
description: Danish indie pop band offers a mix of Isaac Brock's vocal tics with Doug Martsch's nasal croon over infectious hooks and sharp melodies.

title: A Wolf in Sheep's Clothing
label: Locust
description: Folk eccentric creates an album of 19th century German art-songs, wholly reconstructed here via skeletal arrangements of voice and guitar.

title: Garden Ruin
label: Quarterstick
description: Latest from the Arizona band is its most straightforward and rock-rooted to date, as the duo economically blends jazz, country, American folk, and indie into concise, well-oiled pop songs.

title: Color Strip
label: Warp
description: Warp debut for this Detroit producer brings to mind the late-90s crossovers between IDM and hip-hop.

title: The Martial Arts
label: Hello Sir
description: Georgia-based band takes cues from a wide variety of indie sounds, ranging from Don Caballero to Drive Like Jehu to Q and Not U.

title: The Charm
label: Purple Ribbon
description: Despite early signs to the contrary-- a conciliatory move away from the brave, sadly underrated Deliverance and a witless lead single-- the Georgia emcee's first LP for Big Boi's Purple Ribbon imprint is a pleasant surprise.

title: Stay Afraid
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Throbbing with cutting, ragged overtones and distortion, the Jagjaguwar trio's second album manages to make noise anthemic.

title: Élan Vital
label: Matador
description: Matador band offers its third album of angular, studio-polished emo-math-punk, here seeming to grow self-conscious and give into pressure to expand its horizons.

title: Tales of the Forgotten Melodies
label: Decon
description: French musician, composer, and beat conductor crafts sample-heavy, cinematic sounds in the mold of Rjd2 or Portishead's Geoff Barrow.

title: Wind-Up Canary
label: Hush
description: Like Nellie, Tori, and Fiona, this piano-playing singer-songwriter blends cabaret, jazz, folk, and pop.

title: Death by Sexy
label: Downtown
description: Featuring Josh Homme on drums, this ZZ/Stones pastiche is proof that cock rock can seem innocent and ferocious at the same time, and that music doesn't have to be ironic to have a sense of humor.

title: The Hardest Way to Make an Easy Living
label: Atlantic
description: Mike Skinner follows two brave, brilliant records with an album chiefly about fame and its attendent trappings. The first two LPs found him clambering for closer contact with the people around him; this record takes place almost entirely in his own head, where he's either engaged in a struggle to stay on the right side of sanity (and possibly sobriety) or to keep his misanthropy contained.

title: Demon
label: Brille
description: Much-hyped indie pop band carries echoes of Architecture in Helsinki and Of Montreal.

title: They Think They Are the Robocop Kraus
label: Epitaph
description: Epitaph offers the first U.S. release from the veteran German New Pop revivalists.

title: Every Day Is Exactly the Same EP
label: Interscope
description: With Teeth single is buffered by remixes from the DFA, Richard X, El-P, Photek, and members of Interpol.

title: You in Reverse
label: Warner Bros.
description: Latest from Doug Martsch and co. marks the first steps of an unexpected third chapter in the group's saga, casting off the usual meticulous guitar overdubs and studio polish in favor of a less refined, more spontaneous approach.

title: Ardent Fevers
label: Alien8
description: The stubbornly indefinable collective crafts its most purely song-oriented collection to date, guiding its sound toward the organic, refracted Americana of acts like Calexico or Pinetop Seven.

title: That Striped Sunlight Sound
label: Yep Roc
description: CD/DVD captures Robert Forster and Grant McLennan on their recent Oceans Apart tour and features selections from throughout their nearly 30-year career.

title: Peregrine
label: Militia Group
description: Indie band captures emo's warmth but not its grating bombast and post-rock's ambition but not its obscurity.

title: Sex Brain EP
label: Bwatue
description: Latest indie rock band to join the Faint and the Pink Mountaintops in having made short releases (tee-hee) about libidinal matters.

title: Return to the Sea
label: Equator
description: After a brief detour as Th' Corn Gangg, former Unicorns Nick Diamonds and J'aime Tambeur return with a gorgeous collection of pop songs that draws from disparate sources such as calypso, country, and hip-hop.

title: You Are There
label: Temporary Residence
description: Latest album from the Japanese instrumental post-rock group displays a conservatory-like studiousness.

title: King
label: Atlantic
description: Excising the weak and awkward bits that marred his other records, the Atlanta emcee's confidence here seems effortless and second-nature, his self-aggrandizement turning relentless and convincing.

title: Dixie
label: Teenbeat
description: Third album from an indie band led by former Unrest leader Mark Robinson is typically confounding and unique.

title: Killing Time
label: Celluloid
description: Welcome reissue of the lone early-1980s downtown collaboration between Henry Cow guitarist Fred Frith and Material's Bill Laswell and Fred Maher.

title: Things Go Better With RJ and Al
label: Rhymesayers
description: Rjd2-- indie hip-hop's top producer-- pairs his gooey classicist strut-funk with the sometimes charming joke-rap of Blueprint.

title: Ringleader of the Tormentors
label: Sanctuary
description: The Pope of Mope moves to Rome and becomes revitalized; with help from producer Tony Visconti, he explores rapturous self-torment with more passion and power than he's possessed in years.

title: Cannibal Sea
label: Merge
description: Merge's Elephant 6 progeny come to terms with some contemporary sounds without straying too far from their cherished 1960s influences.

title: Vision Valley
label: Capitol
description: Third album from the "new rock revolution" leftovers that the NME once called "the Australian Strokes."

title: At War With the Mystics
label: Warner Bros.
description: Indie legends' first new album in four years-- widely tipped to be the group's return to a more guitar-centric sound-- is stylistically diverse and colored by distant, queasy prodcution.

title: Feathers
label: Gnomonsong
description: Psych-folk band-- who've made appearances on Cripple Crow and opened for Sufjan Stevens-- issue its debut album on Devendra Banhart and Andy Cabic's Gnomonsong imprint.

title: Boo Hoo Hoo Boo
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Indie band employs twitchy mariachi rhythms, bombastic klezmer horns, big-top pageantry and found-item drumlines, cabaret-punk vocals, and guitar-rock snippets on its KRS album.

title: Hand Cranked
label: Mush
description: Following his amorphous debut, Fi, the Mush artist has whittled his signature guitar style down to a fine point.

title: Out of the Ashes
label: Shout! Factory
description: First album in two decades from the country singer is also Jessi Colter's initial release since the death of her husband and collaborator, Waylon Jennings.

title: Beat Romantic
label: Arena Rock
description: Oregon instrumental post-rock duo lays a bevy of acoustic elements over modulating, soft-focus synthesizers.

title: Wayfaring Strangers: Ladies From the Canyon
label: Numero Group
description: Latest from Chicago-based Numero Group focuses on Joni Mitchell-influenced coffeehouse folk, mostly recorded during the first half of the 1970s.

title: 'Sno Angel Like You
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Giant Sand leader teams with gospel choir Voices of Praise on this delicately sparse album.

title: Standing in the Way of Control
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: KRS band, always a treat live, hasn't tampered with its dated-for-freshness formula on this, its third album.

title: Collected
label: EMI
description: 2xCD collection combines a disc of rarities with a disc of the band's best work, plus some songs from 100th Window.

title: Fishscale
label: Def Jam
description: Bursting forth with some of the most pungent yarns, potent barbs, and peerless production of the Wu member's remarkably consistent career, Fishscale is the choice outcome of an endlessly creative mind using experience as a compass en route to triumph.

title: What the Toll Tells
label: Saddle Creek
description: Saddle Creek band appropriates Southern trad-Americana, from bitterly class-conscious folk to vibrantly violent outlaw country, and runs it through an emo-punk filter.

title: Box
label: Columbia
description: After a series of EPs-- which supply some of the selections here-- Jonathan Bates issues the first proper LP from his part indie, part radio-oriented modern rock project.

title: In Colour
label: Astralwerks
description: Swedish band follows its slept-on eponymous record with an album on which its shambling rhythms are tightened and its Velvets-meets-Motown sway seems more Elton-meets-Lilith.

title: Show Your Bones
label: Interscope
description: New York band follows its debut album Fever to Tell-- this decade's gold standard for transcending indie hype-- with a record that offers only one side of the group's multifaceted sound.

title: Reality Check
label: Atlantic
description: NOLA emcee and original Cash Money member issues his first post-Katrina release.

title: Omni
label: Placid Casual
description: Debut album from an electronic multimedia collective led by Super Furry Animals keyboardist Cian Ciárán.

title: Notes and the Like
label: Morr
description: German lap-pop group follows its excellent 2002 album No P. or D. with this melancholic release.

title: Cost
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Jagjaguwar artist's third LP manages to reconcile the tensions between pop and post-punk.

title: The Tango Saloon
label: Ipecac
description: Julian Curwin's project uses Astor Piazzolla's intoxicating creations as a starting point, drawing in electronic elements as well as snatches of free jazz, cool jazz, and soundtrack music.

title: Ignatz
label: K-RAA-K
description: Not unlike Robert Lowe's fine Lichens project, this oddly glorious record conjures "new American ethnic music" with guitar, pedals, and sampler.

title: Bring It Back
label: Barsuk
description: Organ-and-drums duo gingerly lift the moratorium on six-strings and explore a more varied sonic palette, resulting in their best album to date.

title: Born Again in the USA
label: Drag City
description: Second Loose Fur collaboration between Jeff Tweedy, Jim O'Rourke, and Glenn Kotche is more musically traditional than not only its predecessor but some of Wilco's recent output as well.

title: Detour Allure
label: SideCho
description: Breezy summer indie pop stuffed with wispy male/female harmonies, strummed guitars, and airily recorded drums.

label: Interscope
description: On his latest release, the rock legend betters his work on comeback album Musicology, crafting a record that's more varied and contains higher peaks than its predecessor.

title: Dins
label: Social Registry
description: This NYC quartet eschews conventional structure and keeps the line between song and improv blurry.

title: In a Space Outta Sound
label: Warp
description: Warp presents this comeback album from the bleeps n' bloops and trip-hop pioneers.

title: Invaders
label: Kemado
description: Kemado collects the cream of the hipster metal crop on this compilation, which features Pelican, Wolfmother, High on Fire, Dungen, Black Mountain, and the Sword, among others.

title: When the Going Gets Dark
label: Touch and Go
description: Portland, Ore.-based duo Janet Weiss (Sleater-Kinney) and Sam Coomes embraces fuzzed-out lows, grimy distortion, extended improvisations, and looser song structures.

title: Bitter Honey
label: spinART
description: Debut solo album from the Clem Snide leader is modest yet substantial.

title: Everything All the Time
label: Sub Pop
description: Wedding the elemental, earthworn rock of My Morning Jacket to the atmospheric pop of the Shins or Red House Painters, this debut from Sub Pop signees Band of Horses is immediately, invitingly familiar. But if its roots are recognizable, the music is anything but commonplace.

title: Jacket Full of Danger
label: Rough Trade
description: On his latest Rough Trade release, the New York eccentric and former Moldy Peach at last fully immerses himself in the scummy bilge water of language and culture.

title: Music for a French Elevator
label: self-released
description: This self-released 3" CD-R features four tracks recorded in April 2004 as elevator music for the French Ministry of Culture building, and adds some miscellaneous material from the duo's extensive sound library.

title: Orphanage
label: Western Vinyl
description: This Swedish group's blurred creations are rooted deep in the inexact memories and perceptions of distant childhood.

title: We Are Night Sky
label: Fat Possum
description: Fat Possum release from another in a line of co-ed, blues-influenced duos.

title: Axis of Evol
label: Jagjaguwar
description: New record from one of the other projects of Black Mountain's Steve McBean.

title: The Black Dove
label: Tompkins Square
description: Solid collaboration between the British folk singer and Californian performer/composer.

title: My Dark Places
label: Domino
description: An unexpected comeback from the legendary indie pop band fronted by Dan Treacy.

title: Hello
label: Hard Soul
description: Debut album from an indie rock band that already has a commanding grip on its sound.

title: Codex Teenage Premonition
label: Domino
description: Oddly compiled record draws on the Scottish post-punk band's live recordings and sessions.

title: Murmurs
label: Temporary Residence
description: L.A.-by-way-of-Okinawa pop enchantress Caroline (last name Lufkin) follows on the heels of her 2005 single "Where's My Love".

title: Showtunes
label: Nonesuch
description: Magnetic Fields leader presents an oddly sequenced collection that jumps between songs from his three musical theater collaborations with director Chen Shi-Zheng.

title: Flat-Pack Philosophy
label: Cooking Vinyl
description: Latest record of new material from the firm of Shelley & Diggle finds the punk veterans still trading in both effortless hooks and hard-luck romanticism.

title: Other People's Lives
label: V2
description: First proper solo album from the Kinks legend finds him flirting with confessional singer-songwriter material and tapping into the sounds of the Southern U.S.

title: Rock & Roll Is Dead
label: Liquor & Poker
description: One of the forerunners of Darkness/Ark-like 70s rock revivalism returns with their 10th album.

title: Witch
label: Tee Pee
description: Dinosaur Jr.'s J Mascis gets behind the drum kit for this metal record, a collaboration with two members of Vermont octet and Devendra Banhart cohorts Feathers.

title: Hello Young Lovers
label: In the Red
description: The Mael Brothers re-locate to In the Red Records for their 20th LP in 35 years.

label: Rune Grammofon
description: Recorded at the Parkteatret in Oslo, Norway, in 2004, this live DVD finds the Rune Grammofon band to be more focused and aggressive than on its previous concert album, 5.

title: Dead Drunk
label: Paw Tracks
description: Latest collaboration between roommates and Brooklyn music linchpins Avey Tare (Animal Collective) and Eric Copeland (Black Dice).

title: Etiquette
label: Tomlab
description: Owen Ashworth crafts a delicate, affecting soundtrack to life in your mid-twenties.

title: Halos & Lassos
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Asthmatic Kitty artist continues to explore sugary pop, often here with the help of the Omnichord, a vintage synthesizer.

title: Sound Mirrors
label: Ninja Tune
description: Comeback album from the Ninja Tune success story/90s museum pieces.

title: Victimizer
label: Kompakt
description: Latest Kompakt release from a producer indebted to post-Basic Channel dub techno.

title: Would I Find Your Psychic Guideline
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Secretly Canadian issues this 12"-only, lo-fi side project from Impossible Shapes' Aaron Deer.

title: Dancing With Daggers
label: Paper Bag
description: This Paper Bag-issued debut album is a case study in making the most of a limited musical vocabulary.

title: Lisbon
label: Kranky
description: Picking up on the sound and palette of 2002's Playthroughs, the laptop hero presents a 41-minute piece recorded live during an October 2005 performance in the Portuguese capitol.

title: Not Alone
label: Durtro
description: This 5xCD charity album, co-curated by David Tibet, benefits Doctors Without Borders and features contributions from Devendra Banhart, Bonnie "Prince" Billy, Thurston Moore, Coil, Angels of Light, Six Organs of Admittance, Isobel Campbell, and Matmos, among others.

title: The Tourniquet
label: Filter
description: Norwegian singer/songwriter Even Johensen is the latest in the long line of The Bends/Coldplay worshippers.

title: A Panegyric to the Things I Do Not Understand
label: Gulcher
description: After a slew of cassettes and homemade CD-Rs this is the first CD release for the volcanic post-hardcore trio.

title: Minima Moralia
label: Kranky
description: Japanese minimalist issues his first solo album after a number of collaborations with like-minded Tokyo improvisers.

title: Love Travels at Illegal Speeds
label: Parlophone
description: Like his underrated Happiness in Magazines, the latest from the former Blur guitarist is more accessible guitar pop than art-rock.

title: Fab Four Suture
label: Beggars Banquet
description: Veteran band's 10th full-length makes clear that there is an extremely thin line between revealing your essence and revealing nothing at all.

title: Where the Grass Grows Black
label: Underpop
description: San Francisco band's sophomore album sheds the subdued shoegaze of its debut for a hodgepodge of classic rock flavors.

title: Ahead of the Lions
label: Jive
description: Imagine the Reid brothers and Wayne Kramer uniting to form JAMC5, but hoping for radio play in the 90s.

title: O True Believers
label: Important
description: UK folk-based guitarist fits nicely alongside exceptional talents such as Ben Chasny, Jack Rose, Matt Valentine, and Richard Bishop.

title: Fear Is on Our Side
artist: I Love You But I've Chosen Darkness
label: Secretly Canadian
description: On its anticipated debut Secretly Canadian LP, this indie band embraces a reverent, recondite, and stylistically consistent sound.

title: Fox Confessor Brings the Flood
label: Epitaph
description: The gifted singer's musical ambitions continue to evolve and take shape; here she removes herself from David Lynch-like narratives and embraces the role of omnipotent storyteller.

title: Below the Branches
label: Sub Pop
description: San Francisco musician's self-contained Sub Pop debut is a tightly wound bundle of familiar pop ideas.

title: Under a Billion Suns
label: Sub Pop
description: Veteran grunge holdovers go political on their latest Sub Pop release.

title: Mr. Beast
label: Matador
description: Scottish post-rock band embraces restraint and shorter song lengths on its economical yet still sometimes powerful new album.

title: The Essential
label: Alternative Tentacles
description: Queercore band gets the compilation treatment with this collection of the best from its 15-plus year career.

title: As Templar Nites
label: Dim Mak
description: Icarus Line members do post-punk pastiche on this Dim Mak release.

title: Rubber Traits EP
label: Anticon
description: The title track and Elephant Eyelash single is accompanied by three previously unreleased tracks on this anticon release.

title: Youth
label: Epic
description: Hasidic reggae star and frathouse favorite follows last year's star-making SXSW performance and a successful live album with his highly anticipated major-label debut.

title: The Steady Hand
label: Darla
description: Darla band taps into the spirit of spiritlessness, recalling mid-90s slacker-rock artists such as Guided By Voices and Polvo.

title: Please Come Back EP
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Secretly Canadian debut from this Chicago-based indie band is full of tuneful, passionate singing and lucid songwriting.

title: Ackrill/Venning '91
label: Blocks
description: 10-track, 19-minute EP from the sometimes charming DIY indie pop act.

title: The Maginot Line
label: Sonic Unyon
description: Third album from the full-time project of Broken Social Scene's John Crossingham is the trio's most expansive to date.

title: Untouchable Sound
label: Drag City
description: Few indie bands warrant a third live album, but the Make-Up were famously better on-stage than in-studio: If you weren't there, this is reason #3 to kick yourself.

title: The Loon
label: Ibid
description: Kneeling before Pavement, Wire, Beach Boys, and Pixies at rock's canonical altar, this scrappy Minneapolis four-piece proudly wear their influences on-sleeve, shunning hipster malaise and manic experimentation for hook after addictively anthemic hook. Their total lack of pretentiousness is a breath of fresh air: The Loon brings something for everyone.

title: Kings & Queens
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Second full-length from Thrill Jockey's cheeseball indie R&B; duo fares only marginally better than Har Mar. Maybe there's a reason this stuff usually gets left to the majors?

title: They Mean Us
label: Temporary Residence
description: Temporary Residence issues this debut collaboration between Pinback singer/guitarist Rob Crow and Hella drummer Zach Hill.

title: Rideau
label: Häpna
description: On their finest release yet for prestigious Swedish experimental label Häpna, admired post-rock trio Tape breathe new life into a long-exhausted genre.

title: Call of the Mastodon
label: Relapse
description: Atlanta-based metal mavericks leave Relapse Records for the majors, but remember their roots with this remastered offering of their earliest recordings.

title: Everyone Into Position
label: Beggars Banquet
description: Indie band stitches together a patchwork of styles-- alternative rock, riff-heavy modern hardcore, ethereal post rock, scream-filled metal-- on its second LP.

title: Punches
label: Warner Bros.
description: Named for an R.E.M. track, this New Orleans trio relased this much-ballyooed debut last year.

title: EP C / B EP
label: Warp
description: Warp reissues the first two EPs from its latest guitar-based signees, which features Don Caballero's Ian Williams, Tyondai Braxton, Helmet drummer John Stanier, and David Konopka of Lynx.

title: Inside In/Inside Out
label: Virgin
description: Debut from the well-selling UK buzzsaw guitar band is stylistically a close cousin to the work of the Arctic Monkeys.

title: Future Women
label: Polyvinyl
description: Second album from Chicago's charming, Polyvinyl-signed glam-pop revivalists.

title: Everything Wrong Is Imaginary
label: Mainfesto
description: On this comeback album the veteran indie band's iterations coalesce convincingly into a psychedelic quirk-pop summary.

title: Now Playing
label: Nature Sounds
description: Longtime Queens-based hip-hop producer's official debut is an efficient album full of downbeat, soul-laced instrumentals.

title: Drowning in a Sea of Love
label: Border Community
description: Debut LP from one of techno's poster boys delivers on the promise of his singles.

title: The Exchange Session, Vol. 1
label: Domino
description: The first official full-length collaboration between Four Tet and the veteran avant-jazz drummer.

title: Nomad Junk
label: Faith and Industry
description: After a move toward live-band instrumentation, Kristian Robinson returns to the sounds and themes of his breakthrough LP, Island Row.

title: Up Above
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Thrill Jockey band gets assistance from Tony Conrad on its sixth album, the group's most vigorous and diverse collection to date.

title: Plague Dogs
label: Two Sheds Music
description: Promising indie rock band comes at you with blustery post-rock and easygoing Peach State twang all at once.

title: Missing Songs
label: Warp
description: Warp's first rock signing caps a successful 12 months with this collection of B-sides and demos, most of which originally appeared on UK singles.

title: When the Sun Is the Moon
label: Monitor
description: Three-piece indie band concocts a nostalgic blend of acoustic balladry and fuzzed-out guitars.

title: Toy
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: Curiously humorous and bold debut album from UK native Alisdair Stirling and Bergen-based composer/producer Jorgen Traeen was created using instruments designed for children.

title: Idols of Exile
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Broken Social Scene guitarist's latest features contributions from his Arts & Crafts mates Leslie Feist, Amy Millan, and Kevin Drew.

title: All the Love I Could Find
label: Flameshovel
description: Second album from Chicago's backwoods balladeers features a contribution from Kelly Hogan and shares the same spirit as the work of Jeffrey Lee Pierce.

title: The Lovvers
label: Skin Graft
description: Much-hyped debut album from the Montreal no-wave revivalists and Wolf Parade compatriots seems designed to sell chaos as a lifestyle.

title: Six Demon Bag
label: Ace Fu
description: Sophomore album from Philly-based Waits/Zappa/Beefheart obsessives asks us this time out not to merely delight in its sounds, but in its songs as well.

title: Young for Eternity
label: Sire
description: English trio is the latest group to earn buzz for its bubbly, youthful guitar pop.

title: Come Clarity
label: Ferret Music
description: Slight return to form combines death metal's speed and vocals, powerful guitar harmonies and melodies, and rapid time changes.
