title: Snow Borne Sorrow
label: Samadhi Sound
description: David Sylvian follows his excellent Blemish with an album that, likes its predecessor, reflects the state of the war-torn world and the crisis in its creator's personal life.

title: Johnny Boy
label: Wild Kingdom
description: Londoners aim to build on their exceptional "You Are the Generation..." single with a record of politically informed indie pop.

title: Free in the Streets
label: Defend Music
description: Paul Sevigny and co. follows their much-hyped debut with, for better or worse, a more mature second effort.

title: No Word From Tom
label: Nettwerk
description: Odds-and-sods collection includes demos, live cuts, covers, alternate takes, and non-album tracks.

title: Scalpel Slice
label: Fire
description: Collaborative mini-album between photographer-cum-poet Gerry Mitchell and the rustic-yet-dark band Little Sparta.

title: Black Magic Show
label: Hollywood
description: Former NYC buzzband offers a digital release of its sophomore album roughly two months before it's available in stores.

title: I Am the Resurrection: A Tribute to John Fahey
label: Vanguard
description: Co-organized by M. Ward, this 13-track collection pays homage to the folk legend and his brilliant, eccentric creations, and features contributions from Sufjan Stevens, Devendra Banhart, and Jack Rose among others.

title: Silent Shout
label: Mute
description: Ditching the springy Europop of 2004's Deep Cuts, Sweden's the Knife here pits dark, ghostly electro backdrops against elastic vocals, which they mash through a wringer of digital manipulation. A far cry from the duo's friendly first singles, Silent Shout gorily births the Knife's mutant twin. The result is creepy enough to warrant its own genre: haunted house.

title: Vampire Circus
label: Southern Lord
description: Weedburning, mid-tempo riffs from this Southern Lord metal band.

title: Audition
label: Rhymesayers
description: Latest from one of the crop of distortion-loving, snarky Minneapolis MCs, DJs, and producers features contributions from Slug, Craig Finn, and Bouncing Souls singer Greg Attonito.

title: Magnificent City
label: Project Blowed
description: Freestyle Fellowship veteran teams his typically likable, big-hearted style with star indie hip-hop producer Rjd2.

title: Generation
label: Astralwerks
description: Scattershot collection from one-time UK garage chancers.

title: Super Extra Gravity
label: Interscope
description: Swedish group follows its underrated, melancholic Long Before Daylight by turning toward jagged country-rock.

title: The Minus 5
label: Yep Roc
description: Also known as "The Gun Album", the Scott McCaughey-centered group's latest features contributions from members of Wilco, R.E.M., and the Decemberists.

title: Broom
artist: Someone Still Loves You Boris Yeltsin
label: self-released
description: Fuzzily engineered indie rock from this dual-vocaled combo.

title: Paquet Surprise
label: Carpark
description: Carpark issues this acrobatic electro-acoustic record, which teems with whispered field recordings, pretty experimentalism, and sunny pop.

title: Donuts
label: Stones Throw
description: Jay Dee continues to update soul music by paying homage to the selfsame sounds he's modernizing.

title: October Language
label: Carpark
description: New Orleans band follows in the shimmery, usually electronics-led footsteps of JAMC, Fennesz, and Tim Hecker.

title: To: Elliott / From: Portland
label: Expunged
description: Tribute record to the late Elliott Smith features contributions from Oregon-based artists such as the Decemberists, the Thermals, and Eric Matthews.

title: She Wants Revenge
label: Geffen
description: Modern rock radio-friendly new wave revivalism from Justin Warfield.

title: Lindstrøm & Prins Thomas
label: Eskimo
description: Debut full-length from the influential production team is, unfortunately, not a compilation of their frequently exquisite singles but an album of mostly new material.

title: Pop Ambient 2006
label: Kompakt
description: Sixth edition in Kompakt's annual collection of low-key house features contributions from Justus Köhncke, Markus Guentner, and Mikkel Metal.

title: Lantern
label: Brassland
description: Strongest record yet from the adventurous post-rock band, which features the National guitarist Bryce Dessner.

title: Comfort of Strangers
label: Astralwerks
description: After MOR disappointment Daybreaker, the English chanteuse teams with Jim O'Rourke on this mellifluously voiced collection of songs.

title: Security Screenings
label: Warp
description: Latest from Scott Herren features guest appearances by Four Tet, TV on the Radio's Tunde Adebimpe, and Mobb Deep's Prodigy, and finds the producer regaining some of the focus he lost on last year's Surrounded by Silence.

title: Stay in the Shade EP
label: Hidden Agenda
description: Up-and-coming singer/songwriter follows his increasingly popular debut with this five-track EP, which features a Kylie Minogue cover.

title: The Life Pursuit
label: Matador
description: Spanning glam, soul, country, and '70s AM rock, the latest from the indie pop group is a deceptively wry, wickedly tuneful testament to the fragile beauty of faith, in deities as well as in pop.

title: Last Night Becomes This Morning
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Clever song titles and intertextuality color the latest from this Secretly Canadian indie band.

title: Plastic Explosives
label: Hometapes
description: This D.C. band wraps its tales of modern life-- office supplies, airport security, long-distance correspondence, and dayjob malaise-- in constantly shifting arrangements.

title: Eccentric Soul: The Deep City Label
label: Numero Group
description: Another tremendous reissue from Chicago's Numero Group, this is the third in the Eccentric Soul series, this time collecting the best from Miami's Deep City label.

title: Everything Ecstatic 2
label: Domino
description: This companion piece to Kieran Hebden's 2005 album features film shorts commissioned for each of that album's 10 tracks as well as a 35-minute bonus CD of new material.

title: Future Retro
label: Rhino
description: 1980s new wave hits remixed by producers such as Richard X, Tiga, and the Crystal Method.

title: Harpoon
label: Secret Eye
description: Solo album from former Dirty Projectors member is an idiosyncratic take on rustic Appalachian folk.

title: Africa Unite: The Singles Collection
label: Island
description: Twenty-track compilation repeats most of frathouse standard Legend and includes a new track cobbled together from 1979 acoustic recordings as well as remixes from Ashley Beedle and will.i.am.

title: Perfect Pitch Black
label: Hydra Head
description: The once-abrasive Hydra Head band continues to work with catchy melodies, infectious riffing, and smooth vocals.

title: What Else Is There? EP
label: Astralwerks
description: Astralwerks EP features remixes from first-tier producers such as Vitalic, Anders Trentemøller, and Jacques Lu Cont.

title: Too Old, Too Cold EP
label: Peaceville
description: Teaser for the The Cult Is Alive finds the black metal group covering Siouxsie & the Banshees and creating the most crisp music of their career.

title: Levitation
label: Leo
description: Best of four albums released last year from Irish jazz guitarist O'Leary documents a five-year-old session with trumpeter Tomasz Stanko and veteran drummer Billy Hart.

title: The Garden of Brokenness
description: More sad, slow yet beautiful piano loops built from recently reconstituted old tapes.

title: One
label: Thirsty Ear
description: Latest Thirsty Ear release often resembles the early 20th century piano studies of Ravel or Debussy as closely as it does modern jazz.

title: Albatross
label: Yep Roc
description: Melodramatic Yep Roc band builds a quiet tension between guitars, pianos, and Tim Putnam's terse yelp.

title: Sunbomber EP
label: 5RC
description: Five-song EP displays the NYC free/noise/improv band's most overt minimalist pop gestures yet.

title: Makers
label: Barsuk
description: Seattle singer-songwriter retools and finally issues this Barsuk release a year after his rough draft started making the file-sharing rounds.

title: From a Compound Eye
label: Merge
description: Former Guided by Voices leader starts the next phase of his voluminous career with this, his debut solo album for Merge.

title: Spectacular of Passages
label: Social Registry
description: Idyllic bedroom psychedelia takes pop orchestrations to previously unimagined levels of insulation.

title: The Departures EP
label: Kora
description: Appropriately titled EP deals with holding off the heartbreak and daunting logistics of moving on after a breakup.

title: Amber
label: Domino
description: English band unveils its third album of sleepy, sylvan pop, which harmoniously meshes fiery guitars and ostentatious instrumentation.

title: Omnibus
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Early work from the Decemberists' Colin Meloy, this record collects the best from an indie-folk band he fronted during his days as an undergraduate in Montana.

title: If You Didn't Laugh, You'd Cry
label: Yep Roc
description: Latest from the Springsteen-aping Philly band.

title: Far Away Trains Passing By
label: City Centre Offices
description: First issued on City Centre, this ambient techno LP is expanded to a 2xCD set for its U.S. bow.

title: Boduf Songs
label: Blue Baby
description: Kranky reissues the debut LP from English bard Mat Sweet, originally released as a CD-R in 2004.

title: The Indian Tower
label: Drag City
description: Drag City power trio are another in a line of indie bands re-discovering the joys of classic rock.

title: Beyond Reinforced Jewel Case
label: 5RC
description: Odd yet striking work from Brendan Fowler, who has been referred to as a motivational rapper, a comedian, and a performance artist.

title: Beautiful Seizure
label: Leaf
description: Debut album from the Chicago art-rock trio is full of unpredictable, volatile compositions.

title: Crusades
label: Frenchkiss
description: Anthemic indie band goes for expertness in place of pure exuberance on its Frenchkiss debut.

title: Whatever People Say I Am, That's What I'm Not
label: Domino
description: Their LP was only released two days ago but these Sheffield teens are already considered the UK's biggest new band since Oasis.

title: Zodiac Zoo
label: Skin Graft
description: Former Arab on Radar guitarist Jeff Schneider leads this noise-rock combo.

title: What Are You On?
label: Merge
description: Merge issues the latest from singer/songwriter F.M. Cornog.

title: Sun, Sun, Sun
label: Sub Pop
description: Blake Sennett creates a modern pop simulacrum of traditional country, devoid of the electro accents that pocked his most recent record.

title: Black Acetate
label: Astralwerks
description: Disappointingly tame effort from the usually unpredictable Welshman.

title: Film School
label: Beggars Banquet
description: Now a quintet, the Bay Area band follows a handful of well-received demos and EPs with this LP of atmospheric rock.

title: Elf-Titled
label: 5RC
description: Second album of covers of classic video-game music from the 5RC-signed quartet.

title: The Early Years
label: Absolutely Kosher
description: Absolutely Kosher presents a collection of first steps from Jason Zumpano.

title: The Greatest
label: Matador
description: The Greatest

title: Space Shift
label: Sound in Color
description: Former Spacek head offers his solo debut, highlighted by a J Dilla-produced single.

title: As Is Now
label: Yep Roc
description: Yep Roc issues the latest from the former Jam leader and current elder statesman for Britain's trad-rock community.

title: Straight to the Pros: Dragged-N-Chopped
label: Hypnotize Minds
description: Debut album from the protégé of Three-6 Mafia house producers DJ Paul and Juicy J.

title: Fonotone Records
label: Dust-to-Digital
description: Third release from the incomparable Atlanta label Dust-to-Digital compiles 131 tracks from Joe Bussard's Fonotone Records, "the last of the 78 rpm record labels," over five discs, and adds a 160-page book, 17 color postcards, three record label reproductions, and a nickel-plated pop-bottle opener.

title: The Men Album
label: Atavistic
description: Former Swans leader drafts Low's Alan Sparhawk, Chris Connelly, Blixa Bargeld, and others to assist with this 20-track, 2xCD release.

title: Rats! Sing! Sing!
label: GSL
description: Veteran San Diego band blend bratty discopunk, brooding college rock, and dub.

title: The Cellar Door Sessions 1970
label: Columbia
description: 6xCD set contains six sets recorded at Washington D.C.'s tiny The Cellar Door, including material that was rearranged and issued on 1971's Live-Evil.

title: Cicada
label: self-released
description: Originally self-released in 2004, this LP-- chockablock with ideas, encompassing an impressive breadth of styles and sounds-- is given a welcome reissue.

title: Hello Mom!
label: Bpitch Control
description: Crossover-ready electro-pop from Bpitch Control.

title: The Complete Guide To Insufficiency
label: Plug Research
description: Like Richard Youngs, Ben Chasny, and early Devendra Banhart, this Leeds native explores the apocalyptic, alchemical side of contemporary folk-pop.

title: The Ape of Naples
label: Threshold House
description: This collection was assembled from the late Jhonn Balance's final recordings and earlier, uncompleted material originally recorded at Trent Reznor's New Orleans studio.

title: Silver Bear Mist
label: VHF
description: Former Skullflower leader Matthew Bower unveils his latest, lengthy drone excursion.

title: Holy Fuck
label: Dependent
description: Rhythmically adept Beans backup band aims to create the equivalent of modern electronic music without actually using the techniques-- looping, splicing, programming.

title: Tha Carter II
label: Cash Money
description: Veteran rapper breaks from Mannie Fresh and grows up quickly, displaying a flexible flow and more layered lyrics.

title: Pretty Hate Machine
label: TVT
description: Out of print for three years, Trent Reznor's debut is reissued by Rykodisc with neither bells nor whistles.

title: Coptic Light
label: No Quarter
description: Debut from the post-rock supergroup-- it features members of Don Caballero, Storm and Stress, and Antioch Arrow-- swells with fluid improvisational riffs and dizzying rhythms.

title: A Week of Kindness
label: Pickled Egg
description: Mancunian duo follow its underrated 2003 cult-fave The Magic Lantern with another record of rain-soaked indie pop.

title: Hesitation Eyes
label: Heatstroke
description: Pop/alt-country duo issue their third LP and first created via the ever-popular tapes-through-the-mail technique.

title: Morningwood
label: Capitol
description: Next in a line of NYC retro-fetishists, Morningwood's LP reads like their AudioScrobbler, systematically tallying new wave and glam ingredients with the utmost clarity.

title: Whohm
label: Lovitt
description: An attractive disjunct between spazz rock, rhythmic linearity, and a surprising touch of tenderness.

title: You Are (Variations)
label: Nonesuch
description: The composer's first new work since 2002's Three Tales finds him working with choral and orchestral elements, but is as rhythmically driven as anything he's done in years.

title: Pink
label: Diwphalanx
description: Japanese sludge trio unleash their most melodic, conventionally structured, and aggressively addictive LP to date: Flirting with shoegaze and ambient, Pink is a 47-minute frenzy that welcomes 2006 with open arms, bludgeoning fists, and a call to arms against MOR complacency.

title: The Greatest
label: Polydor
description: Best-of collection from the uneven solo career of the former Stone Roses leader.

title: Rantology
label: Sanctuary
description: Poorly executed and ultimately unnecessary odds'n'sods compilation from the industrial legends.

title: Forest
label: No Quarter
description: Proggy metal riffed on keyboards and organs and operatic vocals color this Finnish band's latest release.

title: The Logic of Building the Body Plan EP
label: Flameshovel
description: Generous seven-track EP from the quickly developing indie rock band.

title: The Naïve Shaman
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Latest Jagjaguwar release from the prolific Glaswegian free music maverick.

title: High School Reunion: A Tribute to Those Great 80s Films
label: American Laundromat
description: Subtitled "A Tribute to Those Great 80s Films" this release features Frank Black, Kristin Hersh, Matthew Sweet, and more covering tracks from two-decades-old teen flicks.

title: Dreamies: 2006 Special Edition
label: Gear Fab
description: Bill Holt's brilliant, odd one-off-- inspired by John Cage and the Beatles' "Revolution 9"-- is given a reissue.

title: Duets: The Final Chapter
label: Atlantic
description: Shameless holiday cash-grab recycles old Biggie verses in new songs that feature contributions from Jay-Z, Just Blaze, and, um, Korn.

title: Learn: The Songs of Phil Ochs
label: Hush
description: Indie band not only revives the 60s protest singer's songs on this covers album but studies and evangelizes them.

title: Bells Break Their Towers
label: Strange Attractors Audio House
description: After a half-decade wait, the improvisational duo issue another LP of finely-textured ambient rock.

title: Peace Trials
label: Load
description: Load artist offers a mix of distracted psych, gritty electronics, self-made machines that don't work half the time, and a mostly implied ultra-left politic.

title: First Impressions of Earth
label: RCA
description: First Impressions of Earth

title: Hey People!
label: Domino
description: Retro garage-punk band fronted by Michael Beckett (Kpt.Michi.Gan, Schneider TM).

title: Nite Versions
label: PIAS
description: Remix album greatly improves on last year's disappointing Any Minute Now.

label: Lost Highway
description: Prolific singer/songwriter issues his third full-length of the year, a conceptual work on which each track portrays the singer, now 31, at a different year in his twenties.

title: Hard to Love a Man EP
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Latest from Jason Molina's band includes three new songs and a cover of "Werewolves of London".

title: Ominosity
label: Eyeball
description: Fifth album from the shapeshifting post-hardcore band.

title: Soon There Will Be... EP
label: Beggars
description: Debut release from former Mclusky guitarist John Chapple.

title: Black One
label: Southern Lord
description: Sixth album from the doom metal duo nearly matches their ferocious live power, and features assistance from noise icon John Wiese and experimental guitarist and percussionist Oren Ambarchi.

title: Talk Like Blood
label: Polyvinyl
description: Spacious, intricately polished guitar rock meets chorus-busting emo.

title: Here Where Nothing Grows
label: Important
description: Three-song, 65-minute debut from the Maine metal band.

title: Downtown Science
label: Ninja Tune
description: Relatively sedate instrumental hip-hop from Ninja Tune.

title: Lost Horizon
label: Aero
description: On its sixth album the indie pop band explores wide-open, arid spaces and increasingly darker territory.

title: This Is Where Our Hearts Collide
label: Fat Cat
description: These Swedes' Fat Cat-released LP is reminiscent of the windswept Americana of Sun Kil Moon, Songs:Ohia, or pre-Z My Morning Jacket.

title: Flags of the Sacred Harp
label: ATP
description: Portland-based collective builds on the lessons of The Sacred Harp and other traditional blues and gospel sources on this evocative yet deeply personal LP.

title: Guerolito
label: Interscope
description: Track-by-track Guero remix album features nine previously unreleased mixes and contributions from Air, Boards of Canada, Diplo, Islands, and El-P, among others.

title: On the Outside
label: EMI
description: Former NME hypes, still plugging along.

title: What the Game's Been Missing!
label: Def Jam
description: Dipset member's latest studio album features highlights from his Back Like Cooked Crack mixtape series, plus previously unreleased material.

title: Blurred in My Mirror
label: Room40
description: Japanese singer's sixth album blends the emotional resonance of pop with the challenges of the avant garde.

title: The Complete Motown Singles, Vol. 3: 1963
label: Hip-O Select
description: Third volume in Hip-O Select's Motown series features every A- and B-side the legendary Detroit label issued in 1963.

title: If You Were Born Overseas
label: self-released
description: On this tour-only, self-released album, frontman Adam Selzer comes across like a mix of Colin Meloy and Mark Kozelek.

title: Kosmischer Pitch
label: ~scape
description: On his latest album, the German producer draws from the obsessed-over rock produced by his countrymen in the 1970s.

title: L.S.T.
label: Compare Notes
description: Second album from this Japanese artist is more song-based and less evocative than his intriguing debut.

title: Singles
label: London
description: Double disc collects every UK A-side from the dance/indie/pop band's legendary career.

title: February
label: Table of the Elements
description: As co-founder of Swans and a volcanic drummer behind such notables as Rhys Chatham and La Monte Young, Jonathan Kane ...

title: Crime & Dissonance
label: Ipecac
description: Ipecac's 2xCD compilation digs beyond western scores and 1980s digital experiments to his music for 1960s and 70s Italian crime and exploitation movies.

title: Wait Long By the River and the Bodies of Your Enemies Will Float By
label: ATP
description: Australian quartet plays tight, working-class rock, creating vocal-shredding songs crammed with crammed with drunkenness, night sweats, and suicide notes.

title: Brocade
label: Strange Attractors Audio House
description: Connecticut-based quartet moves away from dreamcore on this slight return to the gauzy space-rock of their earlier work.

title: Escape From Dragon House
label: M80 Music
description: L.A.-based band fold Ethiopian touches into a Cambodian style of pop heavily influenced by classic American surf rock and Nuggets-era garage-psych.

title: Expedition to the Hairier Peaks
label: Corleone
description: Latest from Lightning Bolt's Brian Chippendale and Forcefield's Matt Brinkman is rawer and more cavernous than its predecessors.

title: Nine Times That Same Song
label: What's Your Rupture?
description: Swedish lo-fi indie pop group follows two singles of gritty heartache with a stellar debut for New York's What's Your Rupture? label. This is the first great band of 2006.

title: Curtain Call: The Hits
label: Interscope
description: Hip-hop legend frustratingly collects the hits, saves some of his best work for a tack-on bonus disc, and adds a few mostly insignificant new tracks.

title: The Enemy of Love
label: Merge
description: Merge issues the second solo album from the former co-leader of Spent.

title: The Sound of Revenge
label: Interscope
description: Sly, quick-tongued Houston emcee and former partner with Paul Wall trades candy paint for more serious subjects.

title: Kosi Comes Around
label: Kompakt
description: Debut LP from one of Kompakt's more underrated producers is also the label's best artist album of the year.

title: Book of Sand
label: Kemado
description: Debut LP from the prog-chamber trio combines classical instrumentation and techniques with elements of metal, flamenco, and various pan-global folk forms, and features appearances by Devendra Banhart and CocoRosie's Sierra Cassidy.

title: If Songs Could Be Held
label: Sub Pop
description: This album from the Sub Pop songstress is her first since moving to L.A.

title: Okie Dokie, It's the Orb on Kompakt
label: Kompakt
description: Dr. Alex Patterson's first full-length for Kompakt is full of eerie polyrhythms and slurry dream-techno.

title: Coming on Strong
label: Astralwerks
description: Long-awaited U.S. release from this at times perplexing electronic British outfit, who come across like a mellow, hip-hop-lovin' version of LCD Soundsystem.

title: Rollin in the Ruins
label: Three-One-G
description: Indie band recreates the sleazy skronk of its previous releases, but this time does so without guitars.

title: When the Detail Lost Its Freedom
label: Kranky
description: Not an act named for the Fulham striker, but the solo record from one half of the Stars of the Lid.

title: Pang
label: Columbia
description: The former Chairlift singer-songwriter centers her sweeping solo debut on her powerful voice, crafting love songs about the moment of surrender, the pain preceding it, and the euphoria after.

title: Heavy Lifter
label: Double Double Whammy
description: The duo’s third album is a nostalgic indie-pop rumination on suburban teenhood that thrums with hopeful energy. The best songs are like dispatches from a cracking cocoon.

title: No Holiday
label: Omnivore
description: The final album from the punk trio captures everything that was bratty, tender, and unforgettable about its leading force, Kim Shattuck, who passed away earlier this year.

title: Screamer
label: Mega Collider
description: On the band’s sixth album, frontman Stephan Jenkins Peter Pans his way through an improbably infectious set of would-be hits.

title: Dawn Chorus
label: LuckyMe
description: Pushing beyond his customary dancefloor focus, the French-Canadian producer twists club influences and collaborative input into a textured, exploratory sound, both intimate and immense.

title: As If It Were Forever
label: Alpha Pup
description: The idiosyncratic singer mixes R&B, ambient, and acoustic soul on her most accessible and fully-formed record, one that still feels like an open mic.

title: Singles Too
label: Don Giovanni
description: One of indie rock’s more consistent guitar bands charts its evolution with a career-spanning collection of non-album singles, B-sides, and cover songs.

label: Weird World
description: On his dense but meticulously rendered new album, the British folk singer uses grander pop arrangements to wade into the barbarism of modern life.

title: Metal Galaxy
label: Cooking Vinyl
description: After fusing J-Pop and heavy metal to great fanfare, the duo recruit international guests to expand their sound into even more unlikely hybrids.

title: Neighborhoods
label: Freedom to Spend
description: A newly reissued private-press curio from 1974 captures the bygone sounds of daily life in Portland, Oregon, in dreamy, proto-ambient form.

title: Broken
label: self-released
description: The prolific Maryland rapper is alternately serious, silly, and soulful.

title: True Love
label: You Are Accepted
description: With his intense baritone voice, Devon Welsh travels deep into the feelings of isolation and introspection with grace and beauty.

title: Blood Dust
label: self-released
description: Malcom Lacey’s long-running electro-acoustic project feels like a window into someone’s private world.

title: The Ra(w) Material
label: self-released
description: Two figures of underground rap—Philly’s Sadhugold and Virginia’s Ohbliv—team up for a politically blunted, cult rap record in the making.

title: Let the Sun Talk
label: self-released
description: The latest tape from the 20-year-old rapper is dense and mystic. MAVI delivers revelations from the shadows, concealed and mysterious, in search of fresh air and sunlight.

title: FLY or DIE II: bird dogs of paradise
label: International Anthem
description: The New York trumpeter and bandleader’s second album is darker, denser, and more experimental than its predecessor, but no less resonant.

title: No Home Record
label: Matador
description: After 38 years of making music, Kim Gordon’s thrilling solo debut lives at the vanguard of sound and performance, shot through with the beautiful, unsparing noise that has always defined her art.

title: True 2 Myself
label: Columbia
description: The breakout NY rapper’s emotionally affecting, piano-heavy street tales start to run together at 17 tracks.

title: My Star
label: Trouble in Mind
description: Chicago’s least-relaxed band doubles their personnel and scales up their sound for a set of unnerving new wave.

title: For Your Pleasure
label: Island
description: Each Sunday, Pitchfork takes an in-depth look at a significant album from the past, and any record not in our archives is eligible. Today, we revisit Bryan Ferry and Brian Eno’s glam-rock, art-school masterpiece.

title: Closer to Grey
label: Italians Do It Better
description: Chromatics set their surprise “seventh” album at the witching hour, telling a sometimes-muddled tale of heartbroken lovers reaching out to the spirit realm.

title: Movimiento Para Cambio
label: Pan
description: Velvety, ’90s-inspired deep house and industrial-punk sing-shouting make for a surprisingly complementary contrast.

title: Sonic Citadel
label: Thrill Jockey
description: The noise duo’s seventh album is the most life-affirming and accessible music they’ve ever made.

title: On a Clear Day I Can See You Forever
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: The Scandinavian synthesizer maven pays dusts off dozens of arcane vintage machines in an all-hardware studio recording meant to summon the spirit of bygone circuitry.

title: Two Hands
label: 4AD
description: The second landmark album this year from Big Thief is raw, tactile, and essential. The intimate songs zoom in on a band that feels, at this moment, totally invincible.

title: Odds Against Tomorrow
label: Palilalia
description: Stepping away from the overt historicism of previous recordings, the guitarist opts for a subtler—but just as expressive—investigation of folk and blues.

title: Terror Management
label: Backwoodz Studioz
description: On his bleak new album, woods doubles down on the misery that snakes through all his music.

title: Hello Exile
label: Epitaph
description: What does it mean to get older in punk? Were the good old days ever that good? Though the titles change, the Pennsylvania band’s song remains the same.

title: Old LP
label: UME
description: The ’90s alt-rockers’ first new album in more than 20 years has the vibe of a beloved record that was, for whatever reason, sitting on a shelf.

title: Tell All Your Friends
label: Craft
description: The newly reissued landmark debut from the Amityville emo band takes heartbreak, jealousy, and depression to an operatic intensity, but does so with sharp wit, a knowing wink, and oh so many hooks.

title: Signal
label: Stones Throw
description: The trio’s debut is an exercise in post-punk and no-wave galvanism crafted from throbbing bass, tight-zipped drumbeats, and buzzing synths.

title: Over It
label: Interscope
description: The 23-year-old Atlanta singer’s slow-groove R&B plays out like a telenovela, feeling irresistibly fresh, messy, and human.

title: Ghosteen
label: Ghosteen Ltd
description: Forty years into his career, Nick Cave emerges with one of his most powerful albums yet, an endlessly giving and complex meditation on mortality and our collective grief.

title: Fuck Yo Feelings
label: Loma Vista
description: Throwing open his studio doors, the pianist aims for a loose, mixtape-like vibe, but the stacked guest list yields a scattershot party that only ends up overstaying its own welcome.
